newsitem.title: UK: British election diary for April 30.
newsitem.headline: British election diary for April 30.

text.p: Here are the main press conferences and canvassing appearances in the British election campaign for Wednesday, April 30:
Prime Minister John Major holds press conference at 1100 BST in London with Deputy Prime Minister Michael Heseltine and Party Chairman Brian Mawhinney.
Labour Party leader Tony Blair will be joined by finance spokesman Gordon Brown for a 0715 BST press conference at Labour's Millbank Tower media centre.

Blair will then set off for a campaign tour of the north of England and Scotland. Sir James Goldsmith of the Referendum Party will be campaigning in East Anglia addressing local supporters in Huntingdon and Cambridge.
